Here is some information we recently received regarding the PA Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) program for children:

Q: How can families check card balances? A: 1-888-328-7366 or www.connectebt.com

Q: How can a family request a replacement card due to a lost or damaged card?
A: Parent should complete the P-EBT Inquiry Form at https://www.emergencymealsurvey.com/

Q: What should a family do if they believe they should have received a benefit and did not.
A: All benefits will be processed and mailed by the end of July. If a parent believes they should have received a card and has not after July 31st, have the parent complete the P- EBT Inquiry Form at https://www.emergencymealsurvey.com/

Q: Who can assist parents that are having issues with the card’s PIN? A: Parents should email RA-PWPEBTQuestions@pa.gov for assistance.

Q: Where does one obtain additional information on P-EBT (How much will the household receive, information for pinning P-EBT cards, and much more)?
A: https://www.dhs.pa.gov/providers/Providers/Pages/Coronavirus-Pandemic-EBT.aspx

Other restrictions may apply. For more information or to enroll in the eLearning offer, students and teachers may call 877.955.7328.

The Department of Education (PDE) announced today that all schools in the Commonwealth will remain closed through at least April 6 as a result of the COVID-19 response efforts. The closure order could be extended beyond April 6 if necessary to save lives and stop the spread of COVID-19.

Under the new timeline, school buildings would reopen on April 7 for two days to allow school administrators, teachers, and other staff time to prepare classrooms, set up cafeterias, schedule transportation and arrange other business operations. Students would return to school on April 9, unless extending the closure is needed in response to the situation with the virus at that time.

The Mahanoy Area School District is accepting applications for a Director of Transportation. The Director of Transportation manages all transportation services, works closely with administrators and parents, and assures compliance with all relevant laws, policies, codes and regulations.

Interested applicants must possess a valid PA driver’s license and PA school bus operator’s certificate, proficiency in technology, be highly organized and preferably experience in K-12 pupil transportation services.

If interested, please send cover letter, resume, references, Act 114, Act 34 and Act 151 clearances to Dr. Joie L. Green at jgreen@mabears.net or Mahanoy Area SD, 1 Golden Bear Drive, Mahanoy City, PA 17948. Applications will be accepted until Monday, April 29, 2019 EOE

Two students attended this years Pennsylvania Family, Career, and Community Leaders of America State Leadership Conference held at Seven Springs Resort, from March 20th-22nd:

Junior Mackenzie Siliekus competed in the Illustrated Talk event where she presented her research project entitled "Open Your Eyes," which was also part of the FCCLA national program STOP the Violence. Mackenzie earned a silver medal for her project.

Junior Haley Jones competed in the Chapter Service Project Display event with her project entitled, "FCCLA Helps Us Grow." This project is apart of the the FCCLA national programs of Community Service and Student Body. Haley earned a gold medal for her project this year.

Congratulations ladies!!!

Congratulations to our youth swimmers who competed in Championships yesterday! These swimmers qualified in 67 events and swam their personal best in 58 of them!!!!

One swimmer broke a meet record that was in place since 1998.

Medal count???....a VERY impressive 37 medals from the 72 events they swam!

Of the 23 swimmers who qualified for championships, 20 of the swimmers placed in the top 3 of their events!

Pictured below (First pic) Ben Mentusky, Jake Hillibush, Carly Honus, Kaylee Senglar, Lexi Chilinskas, Gianna Scarcella, Kyler Shapansky, Coach John Honus, Abby Dudash Oceana O'Boyle, Elizabeth Berezwick, Samantha Ritsko, and Bohdan Van Horn

(Second Pic): Lily Lynn, Emma Manley, Julianna Wonsock, Lilly Brown, Kendall Kardisco, Callie Zubris, Gavin Price, Reece Steibler, Kieran Haughney, Coach John Honus, Cameron Zubris, Coach Elizabeth Kalista, and Coach Laura Price.

Way to go BEARS!
